note.p: Death: His rooms at the British Museum, London (09 May 1790)
Education: Frankfurt-an-der-Oder; Leyden; DCL (1786, Oxford); DD (Copenhagen)

Career: Minister of the Socinian Church, Lissa, Poland; Preacher, Dutch Chapel Royal, St James Palace, London (1770); Assistant Librarian, British Museum (1782); taken ill in Sir Joseph Banks' house (06 May 1790)
